metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3466 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pg_ctlcluster script in postgresql-common in versions prior to 210 didn't drop privileges when creating socket/statistics temporary directories, which could result in local privilege escalation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-client-common - 173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-common - 173ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

postgresql - 173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-client - 173ubuntu0.3
postgresql-contrib - 173ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-common package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '173ubuntu0.3').
postgresql-common package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '173ubuntu0.3').
